results.title: Sunrise: a song of two humans
results.creator_credit: William Fox, Fox Film Corporation and Friedrich W. Murnau
results.brief_description: The first intertitle declares “This song of the Man and his Wife is of no place and every place; you might hear it anywhere and at anytime”. This is true of the film as it is a timeless tale of love and redemption. Tempted by a femme fatale, the Man, a poor farmer, is seduced by the idea of murdering his wife to run off to the city with the object of his adulterous love. Academy Award winning, classic silent cinema from German director F.W. Murnau, his first American production. Screenplay by Carl Mayer. Digitally restored and remastered with the original and an alternative new soundtrack, as well as other special features on two discs. Cast includes George O’Brien, Janet Gaynor, Margaret Livingston.

results.title: Sunrise, Sunset: Moni and George
results.creator_credit: Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: Some of the changes occurring in Australia in Australian industry. are examined in this programme. The episode looks at what has been the success of such changes. Moni, a bank employee, and George, an airport services co-ordinator, give their points of view.

results.title: Sunrise sunset
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: This program shows some of the changes currently occurring in local industries, tracing the development of the robot industry and the implications this has had for production costs and changes in job direction. Particular emphasis is on the importance of research and development - ideas and innovations.

results.title: Sunrise profession: land degradation hypothetical
results.creator_credit: John Nicholson, La Trobe University and John Nairn
results.brief_description: Part 1. An introduction to the School of Agriculture courses at La Trobe University, highlighting hi-tech science, state of the art facilities, applied problem solving, global issues, real world economics, innovative teaching and breakthough research. Part 2. An agricultural hypothetical teaching exercise on land degradation dealing with the salinity problems in northern Victoria.

results.title: Sunrise over Tiananmen Square
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Donald McWilliams, Barrie Angus McLean and Shui-Bo Wang
results.brief_description: Shui-Bo Wang offers a personal perspective on the Cultural Revolution in China through the form of an artist’s visual autobiography in this part documentary, part animated narrative. A Red Guard in his youth, Wang grew up in the years of the Cultural Revolution and beyond, a life’s journey that saw him serving in the military as a propaganda artist for the cause of a society based on equality and cooperation until he became an artist and then teacher in the 1980s and witnessed the protests which changed the symbolism of Tiananmen Square for years to come. A powerful statement on an individual, and a generation, grappling with the idealism and intolerance of a revolutionary society this artist’s testimony traces this period in China’s history through a combination of original artwork, family and archival photographs as well as animation and documentary footage.

results.title: Sunrise over South Africa
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger, Grainger Maynard, Maynard and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description: A description of the people, wildlife, political climate and tourist attractions of post-apartheid (1992) South Africa. Covering the whole spectrum of life in this highly controversial country, this video ends with a message of great hope from a myriad of people of all races.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Grainger, Grainger Maynard, Maynard and Seven Network Limited (Australia)

results.title: Sunrise at midnight
results.brief_description: Sunrise at Midnight is both a documentary portrait of Yumi Umiumare, a contemporary Japanese/Australian butoh dancer, and a Japanese Ghost story set in the Australian Desert. The film is inspired by an historic photograph of a troupe of Japanese female performers who toured outback towns at the turn of the century, and the tale of one such performer, Noriko, who wandered into the desert and never came back. Filmmaker Sean O’Brien and butoh Dancer Yumi Umiumare make an expedition into the desert to experience and exorcise Noriko’s lost soul.

results.title: Sunrise at midnight
results.creator_credit: Australia Council, Australian Film Commission, Sophie Jackson and Sean O'Brien
results.brief_description: Sunrise at midnight is both a documentary portrait of Yumi Umiumare, a contemporary Japanese/Australian butoh dancer, and a Japanese Ghost story set in the Australian Desert. The film is inspired by an historic photograph of a troupe of Japanese female performers who toured outback towns at the turn of the century, and the tale of one such performer, Noriko, who wandered into the desert and never came back. Filmmaker Sean O’Brien and butoh Dancer Yumi Umiumare make an expedition into the desert to experience and exorcise Noriko’s lost soul. Performed by Yumi Umiumare and Tony Yap; original music by Satsuki Odamura and Anne Norman. An elegiac and graceful work, filmed on location in Far Western New South Wales.

results.title: Sunrise = 日出
results.creator_credit: Yang Gongmin, Shanghai Film Studios, Yu Benzheng, Cao Yu and Wan Fang
results.brief_description:
Chen Bailu is an innocent young lady, compelled by the harsh reality she is forced into, becoming a social butterfly lost among the Shanghai nightclubs. She spends her days circulating amongst the wealthiest tycoons such as Pan Yueting and Zhang George, living a luxurious and voluptuous life style. The sudden arrival of Bailu’s past sweetheart arouses her memories of a simpler life and the longing for a new beginning. She views her world with disgust and contempt, yet she no longer has the power to break away from her extravagant life style.

One day, Bailu rescues a little girl who is ready to be sold into a low-class brothel and names her “little thing”. Due to the sympathetic feelings towards the likeliness of their fates, Bailu claims the little girl as her daughter and uses all her power to protect “little thing”. However, “little thing” does not escape her fate of forced prostitution, even with the help from the good hearted prostitute Cui Xi, the unbearable insult eventually driving “little thing” into suicide.

At the same time, Bailu’s wealthy lover Pan Yueting loses all his money by going against the underworld mafia’s Jin Ba and is on the verge of bankruptcy, leading Bailu into accumulating piles of heavy debts she cannot pay for. Bailu loses all hope for life when she finally learns her debts are been taken care of by Jin Ba, meaning her ownership has been transferred. In her final moments, she looks back to “little thing” and Cui Xi and refuses to exist as a puppet of upper society. She silently swallows some sleeping pills and ends her life.
(Wendy Xu, 2013).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yang Gongmin, Shanghai Film Studios, Yu Benzheng, Cao Yu and Wan Fang

results.title: Sunraysia Ukulele Network
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: An unlikely group of people come together once a month to share their love of the Ukulele. They meet on the last Sunday of each month at a local landmark called The Old Cottage where they play the uke and have a sing-a-long. Everyone is welcome, from beginners to more experienced players, the door is always open.
